abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report for the Water Supply Project in St.Lucia. The project
            had two specific objectives: The physical objective was to
            improve the reliability and long-term requirements for
            potable water supply within the capital city of Castries and
            the northwest region ofSt. Lucia. Completion of this
            objective was highly successful. the institutional objective
            was to strengthen the capabilities of the WASA management,
            operation and maintenance, and to enhance resource
            mobilization. Generally the findings are in keeping with
            those of similar sector projects in theCaribbean. Physicalw
            orks are usuallyc ompletedw ithout significant problems,but
            thoserelated to institution building,and specificallyto
            improved  financial performance aredifficult to achieve.
            Specific findings and lessons learned are as follows: To
            successfully execute large projects in small economies it is
            essential to use experienced foreign consultants. Limited
            local resources make it difficult to adequately address
            implementation issues in a timely manner. The creation of a
            strong project implementation unit and use of experienced
            external foreign experts ensure project success. It is
            difficult to judge at the time of project preparation
            whether institutional changes mutually agreed upon during
            negotiation will indeed be implemented. However during
            project implementation there was minimal success.
            Institutional change takes time and needs to be considered
            in stages over a number of projects.
